policy_rule: Mandatory Aadhaar-based biometric authentication at Fair Price Shops (FPS) for PDS entitlements
description: V1 seed data for PDS biometric authentication policy stress-testing

hypotheses.mechanism: Elderly beneficiaries with worn fingerprints face repeated authentication failures, leading to entitlement denial
primary_effects: Increased authentication failure rates for elderly
Denial of food rations to legitimate beneficiaries
secondary_effects: Elderly relying on family members for authentication
Loss of trust in PDS system
hypotheses.confidence_notes: Well-documented in field reports across multiple states

hypotheses.mechanism: Manual laborers have worn/damaged fingerprints from physical work, causing authentication failures
primary_effects: High authentication failure rates among working poor
Time wasted in repeated authentication attempts
Lost wages due to time spent at FPS
secondary_effects: Workers avoiding PDS due to authentication hassles
FPS dealers facing longer queues and complaints
hypotheses.confidence_notes: Confirmed by multiple audits in rural areas

hypotheses.mechanism: Unreliable network connectivity in rural areas prevents biometric authentication, blocking transactions
primary_effects: Transaction failures due to network issues
FPS dealers unable to dispense rations
secondary_effects: FPS dealers using workarounds or manual overrides
hypotheses.confidence_notes: Persistent issue in regions with poor telecom infrastructure

hypotheses.mechanism: FPS dealers exploit authentication failures to demand bribes from desperate beneficiaries
primary_effects: Increased out-of-pocket costs for entitled rations
secondary_effects: Beneficiaries bypassing PDS for market purchases
hypotheses.confidence_notes: Documented in grievance records and media reports

hypotheses.mechanism: Women unable to collect rations when household head is away due to authentication tied to male Aadhaar
primary_effects: Reduced flexibility in ration collection timing
Women dependent on male household members
Increased household tension over ration access
secondary_effects: Women's autonomy reduced in household food management
Delayed ration collection affecting meal planning
hypotheses.confidence_notes: Observed in field studies on gender and technology

hypotheses.mechanism: Migrant workers cannot access PDS at destination due to fixed FPS location linked to Aadhaar address
primary_effects: Loss of PDS access during migration periods
Higher living costs in destination cities
secondary_effects: Migrants avoiding seasonal migration due to PDS concerns
hypotheses.confidence_notes: Major concern highlighted in migrant worker surveys

hypotheses.mechanism: IT vendors capture rent through overpriced biometric devices and maintenance contracts
primary_effects: Budget diversion from food subsidies to IT infrastructure
secondary_effects: Reduced fiscal space for PDS expansion
hypotheses.confidence_notes: Pattern observed in e-governance projects across sectors

hypotheses.mechanism: States use authentication data to justify reducing PDS coverage and budgets
primary_effects: Beneficiary lists pruned based on non-usage
Shift from universal to targeted approach
secondary_effects: Increased food insecurity among excluded households
hypotheses.confidence_notes: Documented in administrative circulars in some states

hypotheses.mechanism: High-profile cases of starvation deaths linked to authentication failures trigger public outcry and litigation
primary_effects: Media scrutiny of PDS biometric policy
secondary_effects: Policy rollback or relaxation in some jurisdictions
hypotheses.confidence_notes: Historical pattern from similar technology-mandated exclusions

hypotheses.mechanism: FPS dealers develop informal workarounds (proxy authentication, manual overrides) to maintain operations
primary_effects: Shadow systems parallel to official biometric authentication
secondary_effects: Loss of policy traceability and accountability
hypotheses.confidence_notes: Common adaptation in street-level bureaucracy literature

hypotheses.mechanism: Children in institutional care without proper Aadhaar enrollment face ration denial
primary_effects: Nutrition deprivation in orphanages and care homes
Administrative burden on caregivers for enrollment
secondary_effects: Institutional care facilities seeking alternative food sources
Budget overruns in institutional care programs
hypotheses.confidence_notes: Documented in child welfare reports

hypotheses.mechanism: Persons with disabilities unable to provide fingerprints or face accessibility issues at FPS with biometric devices
hypotheses.confidence_notes: Raised in disability rights advocacy forums

hypotheses.mechanism: Centralized biometric database enables granular tracking of beneficiary behavior and consumption patterns
hypotheses.confidence_notes: Digital governance literature on surveillance

hypotheses.mechanism: Biometric authentication reduces diversion of PDS grains to black market, affecting dealer side income
primary_effects: FPS dealer income from side-sales drops
secondary_effects: Reduced FPS density in rural areas
Beneficiaries traveling longer distances for rations
hypotheses.confidence_notes: Economic incentive analysis from PDS reform studies

hypotheses.mechanism: Granular transaction data enables sophisticated audits identifying genuine vs. ghost beneficiaries
hypotheses.confidence_notes: Intended policy outcome in biometric authentication design

hypotheses.mechanism: Tech-savvy beneficiaries adapt quickly to biometric systems, experiencing minimal disruption
primary_effects: Smooth transitions for digitally literate groups
secondary_effects: Growing digital divide in PDS access
Skewed policy perception based on elite experience
hypotheses.confidence_notes: Digital divide literature applicable to PDS context

hypotheses.mechanism: PDS biometric infrastructure becomes template for other welfare programs, attracting private sector interest
primary_effects: Expansion of Aadhaar-based authentication to other schemes
Private sector involvement in welfare delivery
secondary_effects: Lock-in to Aadhaar ecosystem for all benefits
hypotheses.confidence_notes: Trend analysis from digital India initiatives

hypotheses.mechanism: Opposition parties mobilize affected beneficiaries to challenge biometric authentication politically
hypotheses.confidence_notes: Political economy of welfare reform

hypotheses.mechanism: Remote communities face delayed deployment of biometric devices and poor after-sales support
primary_effects: Extended periods of disrupted PDS access
hypotheses.confidence_notes: Implementation capacity literature

hypotheses.mechanism: Large-scale PDS authentication reveals data quality issues in Aadhaar database (mismatches, duplicates)
primary_effects: Authentication failures due to database issues
Pressure on UIDAI for data cleaning
hypotheses.confidence_notes: Database quality concerns documented in technical audits
